column2: Text
This is test cutscene text.
Continue text. I mean bark bark.
I can talk too.
Same.
Me three.
Welcome to the Garden of Peace.
A place where time can pass and one mind can wonder.
Think as you wish to think.
Feel free to stay as long as you desire.
And leave at the time you prefer.
It is good of you to visit us this day.
I am hopeful we will talk again at another time or perhaps another place.
Ah, welcome to the Forest of Serenity. Lovely place is it not?
For those who know not the context of our meeting.
This very scene will be part of the game called Royal Ordains.
A battle will take place between heroes and villains, as the gods will it.
For now, please enjoy and think further nought of what I said.
Only peace prevails in this day and time.
I am hopeful we will talk again at another time or perhaps another place.
Hmm, as much as I also like it here we have work to do still.
I look forward to seeing you in the game.
A time has pass.
And so begins the story of Royal Ordains.
We welcome you, brave heroes.
We are grateful for accepting our invitation.
Our kingdom is in crisis, our soldiers exhausted.
With your help, our land will persist and prosper.
We sanction you as Royal Ordains.
You are our esteemed guests from the moment forth.
And your valour will be heralded by all for aeon.
Your journey will be precarious and for that -
We prepare for you with supplies and funding.
The Commander will handle your journeys and quests.
May you find success and bring peace to all.
Greetings, we did not expect you to come.
I hope you remember your promise.
Yes. We will keep our end of the bargain.
You siblings' goal will be our spy network’s priority.
Well met, mighty Warrior.
It is great delight to know a man of great potential.
You will surely grow even stronger in the days to come.
I SURE HOPE SO, YOUR MAJESTY.
Very good. We expect great things from you.
Greetings exiled one.
Arhkunihar Tarhandi, your journey here honour us all.
Tarharadun, Your Grace. It is my honour.
Although our lands are afar, we will honour our alliance.
No foes will reach you as long as our kingdom stands.
Thank you, your Grace. I will also help in what I can.
As are we. We also hope you will enjoy your stay here.
Well met again, friend. I see you are doing better than ever.
I know that you two are old friends but pray.
Speak formally in a public space.
As you said, Commander.
Seem that you still travel around. Anything new of note?
Well, nothing as vital as this crisis. Let's catch up later.
Verily. We appreciate your arrival and help.
So who are you?
Hmm, This is the letter I sent to the Sweeper of Szisali.
yes, the blue lizardman.
Court Herald, leave us in private for a moment.
Yes, your majesty.
So I am certain you have an explanation.
i fought the lizard. his skill and strength is good.
i won and then i absorbed him. he became part of me.
his willpower is the strongest of us all. we are driven to join this quest.
So you are intending to join in his stead?
he and all of us will.
I understand. What of your reward, then?
same as before. to done our pledge.
Then may you rise above and beyond mortality.
Your Majesty, I am elated you invite insignificant me.
Your offering is just too tempting to resist.
Say, do you think we can hold one now?
Not yet. We will hold one after your first victory.
Aww, well. A good workout makes everything better.
That will do. Your rewards will be prepared in due time.
Kadazutn, master dwarf. Your presence is uplifting.
Our respect for your rune art is boundless.
Oh, nay. I am no master yet, your Grace. But thank you.
Still, your wording in the letter piqued my curiosity.
Is it truly? Of what are you able to provide?
Be assured that all the words in the letter are true.
HO, HO. Then I see that I must do my VERY BEST.
Well said.
Ah, my Aide. I give you my thanks once more for joining the quest.
See that they become true heroes worthy of our hope.
You can use weapons in the Hall of Blades as you like.
My king, I am grateful for your gifts.
I will do any bidding you ask of me to the utmost.
I shall see to it that the group will grow beyond all measures.
Very good, I am of comfort mind with you in this endeavour.
Be their companion in difficult times but reserve a portion of your might.
Take this opportune time to be stronger. I look forward to your growth.
Yes, my king. As you wish.
Prepare for your journey and be ready.
When you are ready. Talk to the Commander.
Do you have any requests of me?
No, nothing yet.
I see.
You are welcome to anytime.
I FEEL YOUR STRENGTH. WHY HIDE IT?
Why do you questioning everyone about their strength?
STRONG ONE CAN HELP MY TRAINING. WILL YOU?
Well, I am too occupied with all this organising.
Ask anon when I am more available. I may be of help.
AGREE.
Arhkunisai Harsanda .... You are not human, are you?
I .... Yes, I am what is commonly called Sun Elf.
Forgive my rudeness. I just never met an elf before.
I understand you bear no ill will. No offence taken.
But do be mindful that others may not take it well.
Thank you for your advise. I will be more careful.
I heard you are an old friend of the king.
Indeed, I am. Helped each other to survive a troll.
What about you, hmm?
Not as long as you, sadly. Only ten winters ago.
Would you kindly spare time recounting his tale anon?
Yes, my dear. Whenever our schedules allow it.
…My gratitude.
So, an elf servant to a human king.
I thought your kind are too conceited for this.
Mayhap for others. I never believed in such superiority.
I beheld his character, and I offer boundless admiration.
I can see there is something in his royal highness.
Conceivably, one day, I can comprehend in full as well.
I suggest you take a rest and prepare for your journey.
So you are going as well.
Do be careful not to excess yourself.
Talk to me again when you are ready to start.
Hero, it is a pleasure to meet you.
I implore you to take no offence in what I will state.
To be direct, you surely have talents waiting to grow -
but you still need more experience and grow stronger.
For that, although many crises await to be solved -
We will assign you the quests proper to your strengths.
So, talk to me again when you are ready to start.
Are you ready to start your journey?
Very good. Your first destination is Panac Forest.
The incursions in the northern region stem from there.
You will start from the outer forest against rabbitmen.
They are weak, but their number grows alarmingly fast.
Deal with the leader and disrupt the expansion.
We left you the choice of subjugation or elimination.
Subjugation, you may convert them as followers.
Elimination, you can take what they hold.
Your escorts will leave at dawn. For now, rest well.
Take your time to prepare and inform me when ready.
Well, well, a female warrior, eh? Not a common sight at all.
Are you perhaps one of the potential saints?
Silly ol' me, I doubt they want rugged lass like you.
Salute, big man. Your stature is inspiring in strength.
Alas, I myself am not blessed with martial potential.
With one like you in every rank, our army will be invincible!
But, of course, war is still won by a steadfast noble mind.
A lord from another land as our hero? Salutation to you!
Where do you hail from, foreign lord?
Greetings, I am from Garbarra city-state, Far west from here.
As a faraway lord, I am sure you wish to learn of our court.
Approach me at any time if you require, I will be of service.
Good day. This noble me heard you are in the trade of adventuring.
Correct! I have ventured far and wide across this continent.
Good, trade of information I am in and a lucrative offer I have.
A fine exchange will do good for both of us, do you not agree?
Agree. A local information for foreign ones we will exchange.
Fantastic, talk to me again anon.
Well met, dwarf. Before we go on, know I am not of your kind.
I may be shorter than many, but I am still a high-born human.
Salutation, a memorable day today for land's history.
Heroes come to rescue us from all the crises. Excitement!
I do not witness any truthfulness in your talk.
Should I consider that as subordination to our King?
Oh no! Not at all. I do think that more help is always welcome.
Just that this hero group of ours still need to prove their worth.
Understandable, no one deserves respect they do not earn.
Hear hear! Now, just for you, any court rumour I gather -
you will hear it from me first. I will always be here!
To be truthful, we nobles should not waste time with lowborns.
Still, I am in a kind mood, so I will extend my noblesse oblige.
Every time you succeed your mission, I will spare knowledge.
Something you should learn or maybe should not of our land.
Talk to me after you show usefulness and graced with learning.
Nothing new yet. Talk to me after finishing your quest.
GOOD DAY, WARRIOR. I NEED YOUR HELP.
What?
SPARRING WITH ME, LET BECOME STRONGER.
Hmm. If my sister agrees, then yes.
Talk to my sister.
I have a query, miss, that may be rude to ask.
Ask.
Why were you two sisters involved in banditry?
Such activities are rather uncommon for the fairer sex.
Hmm, necessity.
I see this land is also rife in iniquity.
I do hope one day, we achieve true peace in this world.
Say, say, your right eye. Is it working?
Not for me.
What do you mean by that?
Demon blood. It enrages and hunger on sight.
And are you sure it will be safe for us around?
For now. It is still in my control. For a time.
Why are you cleaning your sword in a tavern?
Why not?
It makes you intimidating. People get nervous.
They will get used to it.
Hopefully so. But you should be more aware of your hero status.
A hero…
A good warrior always cares for their equipment. Very good!
… Thanks.
But you should get them repaired soon. Look at the rust and holes.
Come to the Golden Forge, and we will get it done for you!
… I will later.
Later.
Sister, do not forget our mission. It would be a disgrace -
if we fail because you are fordrunken from morn to night.
Well, you should relax some yourself, little sis.
We did not have much chance to feast out in the forest.
Also, that so called great king did promise us with help.
Much easier to find her than before clueless, I am sure.
While you are out on your little journey, I will resume.
You better. I only come here because you pestered me.
I will only stay for this hero stuff if you and they can produce results.
I hear you loud and clear, my little impatient sister.
By the way, your little conversation with that Aide.
I know you dislike the blue blood, but that one may be a tad different.
It is also a wiser action to create rapport with our benefactors.
Rest assured, sister. There is no real hatred between us.
Something tells me that Aide is of common origin.
We will get along just fine, you will see.
Is it now? I trust your assessment then.
Go have some fun, will you?
I HEARD YOU SISTERS ARE STRONG.
I also heard you are pretty strong yourself, big man.
NOT ENOUGH, CAN YOU BE MY TRAINING HELPERS?
Hmm, my sister should be of more help in that regard.
She can help in spare time, but not for free, of course.
WHAT IN EXCHANGE IS REQUIRED?
An experiment and oath of secrecy.
No worry. It will not involve harming you or others.
I CAN AGREE AFTER YOU TELL ME MORE IN DETAIL.
Sure thing, let discuss thing out anon.
Talk to you again later, big man.
Greeting, take a liking to my sister, eh?
Absurd of you to think so. Your social conduct I can tolerate.
But your sister, she ought to learn manners and curtail her hostility.
Outstanding opportunity, that is. Please, be her teacher.
Years of wild vagrancy make her rather shy to strangers.
I could try, but why ask this of me? Should you not help her?
She did not take well with my teaching. Too awkward.
A good friend is what she needs. A wise one like you.
I will consider it, but no promise.
I leave my sister to you. My new favourite person.
I have an inquiry and potential purchase for you, Traveller.
A person I am seeking, and this is the profile.
Hmm, I possess no such information at hand at the current time.
If you can tell me more, I will expand my search network.
But beware that the cost can be high if the leads are too few.
Cost is of no matter. The King will fund such an operation.
We are in agreement then, my information network will expand soon.
No promise of solid leads soon, though, but we will see.
Fortune favours those who are brave to risks, yes?
My lord. You have travelled far to reach this place.
So did you, I see. How fare was your journey.
Not the worst of it. The Empire still agreeably hold itself together.
The prospect does not look so well here in the Kingdom, though.
Aye, seem like it will be our work to better the outlook on that end.
For that, I wish you luck on your quest.
And me to you as well.
Hail! Care to join us for a feast, dwarf?
Truthfully, I am very eager. But I must reserve for tonight's feast.
Ha! Understandable. Maybe next time, then.
Consider it a promise. We shall dine until the very next day.
Cheer to the King for this finest feast!
Welcome hero. My establishment is honour to have you.
You can have food and drinks at a discount price here.
Also while it is not really in my business, -
unfortunate people like to put up help requests here.
Come talk to me if you want to help them.
What would you like?
Remember to eat before going out, yes?
No quests yet.
Greetings, hero. You sure are the talk of the town this day.
Many expect great things from you and so do we.
Maybe the time of peace will come at last to our land, eh?
In any case, we will leave you to your business.
Always great to see you, hero.
Dear Aide, welcome to the scriptorium.
We are now preparing for the writing of the book.
As the King instructed, this will be the finest work of our time.
We also want to show gratitude for your charity and contribution -
We can secure a much greater variety of colouring.
No longer the illumination can only be done with the iron gall ink.
I expect that this commission will bear fruit and impress our King.
We will surely give our all to meet your expectations.
Ah, hero, I bid you welcome to the scriptorium.
It is great to meet you. We all saw the ceremony in the castle.
I am not sure if his majesty has informed you yet.
But we are royally commissioned to record your quests.
Your heroism will be preserved in the Book of Royal Ordains.
In fact, our talk now will be on one of the many pages.
We will work hard and keep refining our craft to create -
the finest work that will exceed the test of time.
Feel free to come visit to see our effort bear fruit.
Say, are you interested in the matter of faith and history?
If you want to discuss theology, talk to me at any time.
Our chronicler members also look forward to talking with you.
If you have time to spare, pray feel free to come anytime.
Do you want to discuss theology and history?
Magnificent to see such eagerness. A rare quality these days.
I am sure you noticed the stained glasses, rather hard to miss.
Marvellous and inspiring works of art, is it not?
The art portrays the First Saint Mother, Caemilr.
It is she who set the foundation of our faith, Ensarae.
Compassionate, kind, affable, yet stern.
Out of all the prophets, only she proved her deeds.
The story was from during the faithless time, a millennium ago.
A chaotic time when people were astray and immoral.
Our faith originates from the City of Valle. Far East from here.
A small city-state surrounded by savages and demons.
Dismal with the chaos, Caemilr descended the Ivory Tower.
She, by herself, declared her radiance and expunged all sinners.
After her passing, many have taken the crown of Saint Mother.
Now, we are led by Caemilr VIII. It is said she is among the
greatest in power. I hope she have time to grace us a visit soon.
That is all for today. I look forward to talking with you more agan.
Another time then.
Your presence is a welcoming sight for us all.
The One God be with you, hero. Gracious of you to visit us.
We are working on the Book of King Lestrius at the moment.
It should be finished soon. Then, we can begin the work on -
your journey's book! Pray look forward to it.
By the way, I am on the duty of illumination for the decoration.
A less prestige work, but still no less important, mind you.
You see, Marginalia, while not part of the main story or text -
can convey or expand what the authors intend.
Of course, simply beautiful decorations make the book -
more attractive to read as well. I am sure you agree.
Well, then I need to focus on my work so we can finish this at last.
Let’s talk later, hero.
Bless you, hero. For your visit this day, inspire us all.
I am the senior scribe of this scriptorium.
I already finished my part in the Book of King Lestrius.
Now, I am working with the supervisor on the first draft -
of your Book of Royal Ordains. Our most ambitious work yet.
With the help of the Master Artists and his assistants.
The book will have the most illuminations in all of history.
With all the details of your journey and in respect to your privacy.
From these two fingers on my hand, your fate will not be forgotten.
Prey, look forward to our finest work yet.
Blessings be upon you, hero. For I look forward to see your deeds.
An assistant I may be, but the work can not begin without me.
For my duty is to prepare the vellums for our work.
Scud the hair, herse the skin, rule the page. All by these hands.
We will fully begin our work right after you embark on your quest.
Our good friend, the Court Jester, will record your journey for us.
We look forward to seeing it and hearing his recount in detail.
Best of luck in your quest.
Well met, hero of the Royal Ordains.
Bless be the King for giving our workshop the chance and funds.
The king's request is that the illumination of your journey should -
be abundant in miniatures and marginalias with full use of colours.
I must admit such details have not been seen in history before.
Not to imagine the expenditure to fully produce such a book.
But he did provide the gold, specialised equipment and station.
A peculiar offer, if I must say so myself. But not one to rebuff.
I and my entourages will do utmost to perfect this creation.
Great day we have this day, hero. I am humble by your presence.
A draft I am making for your likeness for the book of your story.
Now, my meagre talents can not deliver a complete facsimile yet.
But with some creative adaption, I can confidently assure you -
all will notice a clear resemblance of your profile in my work.
And if you are to be open, I would like to make a full portrait later.
A full page dedicated to your exquisite impression. Superb!
Hmm, the head looks a bit too diminutive.
The arm is too long here, I think.
Hmm hmm.
Master, I think I have an idea of the city's background.
With the time constraint in consideration, we should ...
Ah! hero. Greeting. Unexpected of you to come here.
Here is not a place many traverse to beside the monks, after all.
In any case, an apprentice artist is at your service.
Unfortunately, not much I can be of service besides art.
Perhaps one day, I can personally a book for you, yes?
Honourable hero.
Hail, warrior. Welcome to my humble Golden Forge.
Are you looking for a piece of good equipment?
One with standard and not some random unreliable shites?
Look no further, everything I made is all about absolute quality.
True professional work is all about standard, see?
Oh, also, you better not go alter my works at the Artificer Guild.
My love is not for incompetent pompous ass to touch, you hear?
Are you in need of my service, warrior?
Come back whenever you need to.
Hail, fellow artisan. Welcome to my humble Golden Forge.
Your coming into my shop is nothing but a blessing.
If you are in need of my craft, I am at your service.
Ha! No need to be so formal, my good man.
I am still but a learner and your works here impress me.
You know how to elate me. Come, let's learn from each other.
Gladly, my friend.
Are you in need of my service, friend?
My respect and honour to you, dwarf smith.
I have studied your land's architecture for years.
Your kinds are indeed the master of the craft.
Hail and well met, my lord. You must be the Chief Architect.
Architecture is not my domain, I am afraid. But a smith I still am.
That matters none at all. Your expertise requires the knowledge -
of masonry to a degree, yes? Such is dwarven craftsmanship.
You speak the truth. The art of runesmith requires such a basis.
Magnificent! We shall converse on this matter another time.
Respect to you, hero. Today is the day history will remember.
Are you here for the service of the great Smith as well?
The ornament he can conjure is nothing short of magic itself.
His design is unmatchable, just as mine in architect.
I myself am a regular patron here. So we will meet a lot surely.
If you are ever in need of a new house here, I am at your service.
But alas, I am too occupied with the restoration project.
I will inform you when I am available again.
Hero.
Hail, Aide. Very unexpected to see you here.
Why ever so?
Well, I thought your kind considered human craftsmanship inferior.
I can say I thought the same for your kind as well, dwarf.
Not at all, we smith fully respect and learn from each others.
Be it human, orc, elf, giant, fairy, heck, even goblin.
Interesting. Well, I personally bear no such animosity myself.
That is good. I am glad that we can meet on favourable terms.
Hail, warrior. Fancy crafting a new set of equipment?
Yours look seriously worn down and need repair, I am afraid.
It is. Mostly salvaged from corpses. But still work.
Nay nay, my friend. A good warrior need a good weapon.
Come, let’s talk to my smith friend, and let get you good one.
Eh, maybe later.
Hail, lord. In need of fletching for more arrows?
So the smith here works on every manner of craft?
We accept all manners of commission here.
I see, but no, thank you. It is in our custom to craft -
our own arrows. To hunt is to stake your place in life.
A respectable tradition. All should master their own crafts.
I will be out of work if everyone is a crafter, friend.
Ha! No worry. Most will still be not as good as you.
Hail, mate. Fancy a new tinkering for your traps?
What are you, the forge's attendant or something?
I thought we just became heroes of the Kingdom.
Hero or not, the true blood of all dwarves is in artisan.
Ha, I like that. Same for us halflings with the heart of adventure.
So you will not stick being here for long, then?
I will come and go, aye. Depending on my availability.
That will make us both. Well, good talking with ya.
Chat with my friend smith if you need any crafting.
Greetings, Warrior.
GREETINGS, SMITH?
No, the bald man is the smith.
SO YOU ARE THE SMITH THEN.
Oh hahaha.
Well, right, but if you need crafting, talk to that bald guy there.
Great day to you!
Welcome to the great garden of Masendor, hero.
Efforts were made to ensure the beauty of this place.
You probably noticed already that flowers represent -
the symbol and name of the domains in our empire.
The Masendor flower is the symbol of our Kingdom.
Prithee come indulge in this magnificence any time.
Pleasure to see you here, hero.
Hero, what a place, is it not?
No place in the wildness can match such magnificence, I say.
One must mould order out of chaos to find true purpose.
Ah, pardon for being philosophical for our first talk.
I bid you welcome to our land and luck in your quest.
At your service.
Good morrow, ruffle girl. Please, to meet you among the green.
Or black, hehe. Here for a nice view as well?
Just looking around.
Well, have a look then! Nothing but blackness all around.
Such a great place for contemplation. And a drink.
… I will leave you to it.
See you again!
The garden here sure is a sight of magnificence.
The blackness of the flowers and the castle captivate me so.
Good morrow, turban lord. This place sure is great, I agree.
I am not sure morning is the best time for a drink, though.
Folly, everything in life is all about happiness.
Beauty, drink, and food all around!
I reckon you are right in a way. Life is nought without happiness.
So you are a traveller of the world? From corner to corner?
I wouldn't say I have reached the two corners yet, but I did go far.
Well, pray tell, is there any beauty better than the garden here?
Not many in the same category I can think of.
Bialong Sihimrat in the desert plain of Yehman Mullema.
Aelreye Burnat in the Naljesmil Askiron Forest.
Those are the two I can think of. Unparrarel garden of nature.
You have travelled to many places. See far and wide.
But still, the two you mentioned are not of its purpose.
They are not created with the intention to captivate or amuse.
Why do you think they are better than this for its sole intent?
That I can affirm is the nature of us halflings.
We adore the world we belong in. Both the order and chaos in it.
It is no matter the intent or purpose of things but what we feel.
I understand. Pray come tell of your travel again later.
Absolutely, my dear.
Good morrow, elven Aide. So you have not forgotten your roots.
A nice garden you have here. Pity can’t rest among the flowers.
Apology, even if you are now the Hero of the Kingdom.
There are still rules that need to be adhered to.
And yes, even after I become a "City Elf", I still know my roots.
This place here is filled with love and hatred in equality.
Love for the flowers and hatred for the so-called vermin.
It is not in my place to judge, for I also adhered to the rules.
As all in nature live as they do. That is the truth.
Yes, I believe so. I do not wish to take more of your time.
Talk to you again soon. Until then, fare thee well.
You too, elven Aide.
Hmm, a student of stone in my presence.
Your kind are not known to reside in woodlands.
This also brings me to a question, where are the dryad of stone?
You dryads will fare much better in sapping essence from dwarves.
Unlike those meek humans, we are boundless in energy. Ha!
An intriguing offer that my brethren may be persuaded by.
Perhaps feel free to repeat that again when you meet another dryad.
A day like this is rare to see!
Welcome, hero, to my herbalist workshop.
Feel free to browse.
Ah, hero, forgive her manner. Our herbalist is a bit of a wallflower.
I can vouch for the quality of all purchases here, myself!
A regular customer, indeed, I am. So have a look around!
Have a look?
See you.
Hmph, a bandit hero. This human king has a bizarre preference.
Tell me, what feats have you accomplished, hero?
Nothing that I feel worthy of recounting.
Hmph, a secretive type as well. No matter, we shall see soon.
Leave me be. I need to focus.
A lord serving another lord? Hmm.
What is there to gain from such service? Why come personally?
Same as you, noble elf. For unignorable rewards
Fair, I suppose.
We can talk more anon. I need to investigate this shop here.
Why is there no Alkeranoisis Roots sold here?
I thought this is the most outstanding herbalist in the kingdom.
Alas, the cultivation of men will never reach that of the elven.
I wouldn't be so certain of such a conclusion yet, noble friend.
The pace of progression by these humans is astounding.
Perhaps they will never reach the height we stand on.
But I believe a new height none ever reach will belong to them.
Is that your conclusion from travelling the land, then?
Not yet conclusion, supposition. And who knows what time bring.
Hmph, the millennium of my future will verify it for you then.
I require a peace of silence for now, Traveller.
Well met, Mage.
… Sieletan mekrie ane yielwenonsecli.
… I am sorry, I know not the accent of your speech.
I see. Hail to thee, Aide. Is there anything I can do for you?
No, but perhaps I can be of aid. Are you in need of anything here?
I would not trouble you for time, Aide. My task is of little matter.
There is much better use of your time elsewhere.
If you are certain, do let me know if I can be of service.
Another time or day, perhaps.
I am busy.
Hail and well met, hero. Mighty to find you here.
Here, have a whiff of a sniff at this. Smell great, yes?
This herb will be in tonight's feast for you at the castle.
The food will smell irresistible and taste unforgettable.
My pride as an artisan of culinary can promise you that!
Look forward to the feast later!
Greetings and salutations, Aide. A special time for us on this day.
Curious to hear you say that. I did not see you at the ceremony.
Ah, I asked our good friend Lord Steward to attend in our name.
There was, ahem, an urgent matter that required my attention.
If you say so, Lord Chancellor.

Our most yearning wish is for you all to be strongest in all realms.
From the look of the ones in the group, I think it may be achievable.
That extends to you as well.
I do not think I can personally, but maybe someone else in my place.
My family back home will not take it so kindly if I adventuring too long.
But not to worry, my king. That time may yet come.
Do inform the Commander in advance if the situation changes.
Aye, I certainly will.
Your skills in combat are no inferior to your crafts.
A sadness in our heart to be reminded that you will not join our court.
Gramercy, Your Majesty. I simply can not leave my clan.
It is a matter of tradition that we must abide.
Apprentices may tour afar to whet their craft for ten waxing moons.
Masters to employ their craft for the clan, lest their name be stained.
Such is your purpose. We understand.
My Aide, you have followed my instructions well.
I commend you for your outstanding performance.
I am at your command, my king.
That is well. Take your time to rest for today.
My king, I still have my duty as an aide to attend to you.
I can not rest well knowing you still attend to matters of the realm.
I have rested plenty during my travel back.
I can not allow that. You know well that warriors -
no matter their ranks, earn their rest after hard-fought battles.
Such is the custom of our land since ancient times.
Rest for a few days. Afterwards, you can resume your duty.
As you command, my king.
Remember to take care of your health.
A well-prepared warrior already wins half the battle.
I did not expect you to be possessed by such an apparatus.
… Got problem?
No, not at all. Opposite, in fact. Admiration is well in my heart.
You have adapted your ... "shortcomings" into strength.
A feat that few can achieve.
Ehh. Thanks. (Well, that is unexpected).
Forgive me for my ignorance in our previous conversation here.
It is unbecoming of me as a diplomatic envoy to act as such.
It is forgiven. I understand your surprise.
Still, I have never seen a warrior as excellent as you.
You fought with your eyes fully closed the whole time.
And your proficiency in various weapons is awe-inspiring.
I have trained in the art of combat since childhood.
With my longer life than most species, that is a very long time.
How long is that exactly?
Going by the weather cycle here. About 100 winter cycles.
Oh… that is a long time, indeed
So, our great king has a close attendant who is an elite fighter.
Are you actually his bodyguard in disguise, perhaps?
I truthfully thought you joined us only for non-combat support.
My main duty is to assist His Majesty in ruling matters.
This is the first time here I have had such a combat-oriented role.
But still, I will assist our group in all matters in my capabilities.
Reassuring, to say the least.
So now that I have observed your strength. Doubtly at full potential.
Just how strong your king really is?
Old age is not kind to those with a short lifespan.
He fell a green dragon during the crisis years ago. Before I met him.
My my, it is no wonder now how he can promise such a reward.
I think we should all get some rest for the day.
Hero, your success truly please me.
A mark of new growth I can see on you.
The rabbitmen did not cause you much trouble, did they?
You have proved well beyond any doubt of your potential.
With each victory, a full-fledged master of combat you will become.
Do reflect that the mettle of a hero is not only in personal strength.
Prepare well your equipment and bring suitable allies into battle.
Are you ready to start your next mission?
Very good. You will travel deeper into the Panac Forest.
Groups of bandits is using the forest as their base of operation.
The target of this mission is a group named Red Leaf.
The threat that needs to be dealt with this time is smaller in number.
But underestimate not, for they are much stronger individually.
Capture the leader, and the group will surely fall apart.
I leave it to your decision on how to deal with such a villain.
May the One God watch over you.
Take enough rest. The escorts will be prepared when you are ready.
Welcome back, Aide. I expect the foes brought you no trouble.
Perhaps it was your entire doing that the group succeeded at all?
Not so. My role is to simply guide them at this time.
It would be unbecoming of their growth with my interference.
A well-thought decision indeed.
A triumphant hero return! One less trouble, many more to go.
Proven yourself, indeed. You did very well.
As a celebration for your first victory, a blow I shall ring out this day.
Hear me well, the Kings of old. This noble me, the Court Herald -
of the twelve legacies of Maeranos. Bearer of Yorunuit Horn.
This blow is dedicated to the new heroes of Masendor.
That is a fine blow indeed. The sound rings through clear as day.
The kings of old know of your deeds and attend in your course.
I did promise you a piece of knowledge for your victory, did I not?
As you know, our kingdom is a vassal of the Rendos Suclin Empire.
You may also notice that most of the nobles have auburn hair.
Such is the prominent trait of our ancestors.
In times before the empire, we are called the pure blood of Lafinm.
We humans in this region shared a similar root as the northern elves.
The people of the empire originally came from the far west near Valle.
Most of them have brown and golden hair.
A trait that commonly dominates ours when intertwined.
Well, that is all for this day.
The bringer of words has passed his knowledge. Another time perhaps.
What a showcase of strength you displayed.
I daresay you are as strong as our mighty musician warrior.
Your nimbleness with the bow is no less inferior.
Fews I have encountered that match your skill.
I can use some advice to hone my sword skills, perhaps.
Meet me later at the training ground. Some of us will be there.
Very good. Prithee, inform me of the time later.
I have heard of the tale, of an infernal succubus.
Their offspring carry the trait of the seed giver.
With the demonic blood flow inside. And a set of instincts.
You will do whatever it takes to satisfy it. Once you have done so.
The metamorphosis will be completed. You will be a new being.
A being of terror. Hunger that will never be sated.
Until the circle is renewed and new strength is gained.
I know. And we have a plan.
Whatever that plan is. Do it thoroughly and safely.
We should talk later.
Did you find anything of note?
You are way too eager sometimes. We just finished the preparation.
The first operation will cover the whole kingdom's domain.
Then, we will expand to the whole empire afterwards.
Hopefully, we don't have to search the whole continent.
We will have to if it comes to that.
Aye, good thing we have the Kingdom as our backer now.
See? If we continue the search on our own, we will die of old age first.
Fine, but I expect to hear more progress.
Yes, yes, your highness. This lowly scout will try her hardest.
Since I am still sober, there is something I want to ask.
Out with it then.
How it going with your fellow heroes? You did not ignore them, yeah?
Ehhh... I tried not to.
You truly ought to loosen up more.
Do you realise you will fight alongside them from now on?
Yes, I know. I just want to go with it naturally.
I feel we will find her before you have a rapport with your team.
That might actually be best...
What?
No nothing. I will also try my best.
Oh, also, you will have some training sessions from now on.
With the Aide and big muscle guy. It will be helpful for your practice.
They are quite strong. So yes, I have no issue with it.
Very good to hear. You should tell them that yourself, though.
Oh, right, I also want to say that is very unexpected of you to do.
Saving those rabbitmen and their friends from extermination.
Mind telling me why?
I do not know myself. Perhaps I want to break from the circle.
Well, a good start, I suppose. But do be careful.
Some choices with kindness can anger certain people.
Oh yes, before you go.
Congratulations on your first success. The first massacre.
I only did what was necessary.
I know. I do not blame you at all.
This ale tastes so bad I almost miss being in the woodland!
I spoke with my sister, and she accepted a bonding exercise with you.
What bonding exercise are you talking about?
Oh, just sparring matches between hero friends.
At her current state, I doubt my sister will prove a real match for you.
I thought we were talking about etiquette lessons for her.
Aye, we can get to that later.
The most effective first lesson should be familiar to the learner.
One that will get them hooked to learn more from that teacher.
Your reasoning is well-founded. I accept then.
We still have some time before the next mission.
I anticipate seeing the results of our little exercise.
Good day, sister. I have sent out your request.
Time is the only manner of factor now.
Very good, Traveller. I will await with anticipation.
Your target. Is she who I think she is?
I am sure you notice from the battle. Yes, it is as you think.
Are you of certain mind that it is safe to approach her?
Probably not at this time. It is why my sister join in your hero group.
In time, she will surpass all.
My lord, your arrows strike my heart with perfection.
You letting loose of them at such speed. Not even I can match.
Pardon me, you are also proficient in archery?
To a certain level, I am more learned in the art of throwing.
I expect both of you to possess combat prowess to some degree.
But why focus on ranged combat?
I thought your "strength" elevated you above many.
Hmm, well. It is to satisfy a certain condition of our mission.
What a peculiar mission you have to undertake. But best of luck.
Ready for a feast this time, dwarf?
Of course, it is high time!
All those fighting sure make me ravenous.
Let's get to it, then!
Mhmm. Not too shabby. The beer is a bit of a travesty of the real one.
Agree on that. We should try brewing our own at some point.
Superb idea. We shall build the finest brewery in all human realm.
We should prepare a plan at our next meeting.
Until then.
You know, I have never seen a chicken with a leg this large before.
Welcome, hero. I do not know what madness possess you to take
Rabbitmen into the fold. I want to thank you, truly!
Your action brings an influx of customers to my establishment.
They love to eat and they do it quick and quite.
My favourite kind of patrons, I say.
Welcome, hero. Congratulations on your first success.
The anticipation of us all is beyond all possible elucidation.
It is rare to see the story of heroes unfold in a lifetime.
I heard those Bunnymen were a real pest in the northern farmland.
I expect grain prices will be much lower soon. So more profit for me!
And that is all thanks to you, my greatest hero.
Want some drinks or food? We have it all.
Come eat soon! Our cook’s hands are getting lonely.
No quests yet.
How is it living in the Panac forest? Must be hard with all the outlaws.
Mi mimi mi mimimi mi mi mimi mimi.
Oh truly? Tell me more.
Mimi mi mi mi mimi mimimi mi mi mimimi.
Astounding! We should start a venture over there!
Mi!
Mimi.
Hail, hero. A fine work you accomplished.
The town crier spoke of you almost all day long.
You did what most could not.
Perhaps one day, you will rise to be a legend in your own right.
Great seeing you.
Welcome back to the city. We saw the recording of your journey.
Impressive is the only word I can offer.
It is our first time seeing a real combat, albeit from afar.
But you fought valiantly and heroically.
Those rabbitmen were nought but a trifle in your path.
Your deeds and actions will soon be recorded in the pages of history.
We have finished the preparation of the vellum processing.
And some of the draft for your arrival and stay in the city weeks ago.
Expect to see some results soon.
Do you wish to learn more about our history?
Our last talk was about our first Saint Mother, correct?
You saw the stained glass art, but did you see the Banderole?
Fides Est Fortitudo. Faith is Strength.
Not in faith we find strength, but faith itself is strength.
Faith is the only thing that truly matter.
Faith is what guide us. To live, to think, and to act.
The lower beings found faith in their character and knowledge.
A lion can only teach its offspring to hunt by the act of hunting.
The higher beings do not need to learn all via physical example.
A spiritual teaching, knowledge can be transferred without requiring -
the present existence of the subject in question.
This is because faith is the foundation of learning for higher beings.
You have faith that your parents or teacher are right in what they say.
And with that faith, you will conduct your life.
We, as a society, can not progress without faith, for time is limited.
Knowledge can only be gained in the boundary of a lifetime.
Faith in your better is the foundation of all civilisations.
I suppose being a hero reduces much time to spare.
Fides Est Fortitudo. Faith is Strength. Pray, remember well.
Well met again, hero. We just finished with the Book of King.
The One God has indeed blessed you with a momentous victory.
Henceforth, we shall begin the creation of your book in earnest.
The Master Artist's draft suggested we minimally decorate your -
moments in the city for this time to focus more on your quest.
We will use only black ink for drawing the city background.
A good idea to lessen our workload while creating a contrast of primacy.
Not much work for me personally yet in the meantime.
I will have time to design the decoration for the battle scenes.
I have high hopes for this work if I say so myself.
Bless you and luck for your next quest, hero.
Magnificent display, Royal Ordains.
Your battle inspires me and my assistants immensely.
It is a rather daunting prospect to imagine illustrating your prowess -
without having seen it with your own eyes.
I have seen a fair share of warfare myself through a far-eye instrument.
But this will truly be our first work that we will spare no expense.
All the resources available will be utilised to the fullest.
We will also order shipments of more ink material for this endeavour.
A morale of the highest order now anchors in this very room.
Perhaps the Saint Mother is watching over us after all.
I yearn to witness your action once more, hero.
I see you have survived the first encounter.
A warrior with good equipment increases the survival rate by 50.
50 what? I do not know. I just made it up.
But surely you now know enough that my crafts have no flaw.
Unlike the random equipment you found lying around.
Reliability, the only component required in this Golden Forge of ours.
A craft a day keeps the nemy’s sword at bay.
Do not neglect to improve your equipment.
Hero, what an unexpected solution you brought for us.
Rabbitmen as civilians. Our workforce multiplies tenfold in a day.
Perhaps the restoration will proceed at a much more satisfying rate.
As long as their nimble paws are also capable of complex tool wielding.
Discipline will go a long way before they can be a good worker as well.
A momentous event in history is unfolding at this very moment.
The securing of the outer Panac Forest will bring a supply of lumbers.
A much-needed supply for the restoration of the Citadel of Dusk.
Our kingdom will be restored to its former glory in time.
The fate of our realm is in your hands. Prithee, treat it well.
So this is why you wield both axe and hammer in each hand.
Is it a custom for runesmiths to wield their craft to combat personally?
Aye, but not purely so.
The creator must also bear the consequences of his crafts.
Such is the first lesson for our crafters, not just runesmiths.
A responsibility of his own crafts by being the bearer, is it?
To hear is inferior than to see. To see is inferior than to feel.
What a strange tradition.
It would be unthinkable for our blacksmith to risk his life in a war.
Well, we also preserve all knowledge in the runestone.
Unlike most that still transfer them mostly via oral means.
We are doing the same with vellum books, but the cost is still too high.
As I heard, your journey will also be recorded in one by the Abbey.
That is so. I never heard of a recording in such a short time.
It is indeed unprecedented. But that is first for everything.
Well met again, Aide. Say, mind if I ask you about your weapons?
Ask away. I expect you are curious about their origin.
Ha! correct. So, are they conjuric in nature?
Some are. But some were crafted in the ancient times.
This axe, for example, is crafted by a master dwarf of old.
Hmm, an earthen element axe. I cannot say I know of it.
What an odd design. Pray, let me observe it more when we have time.
That is fine. I am sure you discover more in time.
Great day, come to get your equipment proper at last?
Eh, I suppose so.
Very good, very good. Good equipment makes half a good warrior.
It matters not what your ability is. We will double you into a better one.
Right. So...
Ah, talk to the Blacksmith over there. He works this forge.
Right.
Hail, lord. A fine display of archery.
I assume you have trained on it since childhood?
Since my memory begins, yes. I remember it more than anything else.
Most of us seem to be the same type. Honing our art since youth.
A mandatory trait to become truly skilled, perhaps.
But I am in doubt the king selected us for just that.
I believe so as well, aye. Each of us is rather diverse.
If the king wants only pure strength for battle, he can train an army.
We will discover his intention in due time, I believe.
Greetings again, Runesmith.
We did not have much chance to converse during our travel.
Aye. Tiredness does make the worst companion for social activities.
It seems I misunderstood you as a trapper of sorts.
You are a tinkerer of novelty and a lady of inner muscle.
That bag of yours must weigh like a boulder.
Hehe, an important lesson for all travellers.
Travel light, and you may escape a predicament.
Travel prepared, and you may overcome it.
You must have encountered many perils, even more than most of us.
The journey to the unknown is full of terrors. This quest of ours -
is no less dangerous and difficult to overcome I fear.
For that, we must prepare thoroughly.
A hammer swing by the anvil. Never to touch in an embrace.
Hero. Here is the busiest day of my life. And it is thanks to you.
I have to spend the entire day yelling rabbitmen out of the garden.
At least they now know to lay around outside.
Any damage done to the garden also inflicts on my reputation.
Do you hear that, rabbits?! Do not disturb the garden!
Do not dig a hole in the ground here!
Come to immerse in the garden's beauty once again?
It is irresistible, I know. The blackness that draws in your soul.
Ah ahem. Pardon me.
Even as a caretaker of this great achievement, I still feel dazed by it.
I think we may need to install a fence.
So I heard our king passed a new law that rabbitmen are now citizens.
I hope they do not mind us hunting hares as food and game.
It will be a huge predicament for our meat supply.
And, of course, the quality of the game I can organise.
I hope the wiseness of our king surpasses his generosity.

column4: At your service.
Good morrow, ruffel girl. Please, to meet you among the green.
Or black, hehe. Here for a nice view as well?
Just looking around.
Well, have a look then! Nothing but blackness all around.
Such a great place for contemplation. And a drink.
… I will leave you to it.
See you again!
The garden here sure is a sight of magnificence.
The blackness of the flowers and the castle captivate me so.
Good morrow, turban lord. This place sure is great, I agree.
I am not sure morning is the best time for a drink, though.
Folly, everything in life is all about happiness.
Beauty, drink, and food all around!
I reckon you are right in a way. Life is nought without happiness.
So you are a traveller of the world? From corner to corner?
I wouldn't say I have reached the two corners yet, but I did go far.
Well, pray tell, is there any beauty better than the garden here?
Not many in the same category I can think of.
Bialong Sihimrat in the desert plain of Yehman Mullema.
Aelreye Burnat in the Naljesmil Askiron Forest.
Those are the two I can think of. Unparrarel garden of nature.
You have travelled to many places. See far and wide.
But still, the two you mentioned are not of its purpose.
They are not created with the intention to captivate or amase.
Why do you think they are better than this for its sole intent?
That I can affirm is the nature of us halflings.
We adore the world we belong in. Both the order and choas in it.
It is no matter the intent or purpose of things but what we feel.
I understand. Pray come tell of your travel again later.
Absolutely, my dear.
Good morrow, elven Aide. So you have not forgotten your roots.
A nice garden you have here. Pity can’t rest among the flowers.
Apology, even if you are now the Hero of the Kingdom.
There are still rules that need to be adhered to.
And yes, even after I become a "City Elf", I still know my roots.
This place here is filled with love and hatred in equality.
Love for the flowers and hatred for the so-called vermins.
It is not in my place to judge, for I also adhered to the rules.
As all in nature live as they do. That is the truth.
Yes, I believe so. I do not wish to take more of your time.
Talk to you again soon. Until then, fare thee well.
You too, elven Aide.
Hmm, a student of stone in my presence.
Your kind are not known to reside in woodlands.
This also brings me to a question, where are the dryad of stone?
You dryads will fare much better in sapping essence from dwarves.
Unlike those meek humans, we are boundless in energy. Ha!
An intriguing offer that my brethren may be persuaded by.
Perhaps feel free to repeat that again when you meet another dryad.

column2: These rabbitmen are quite cute and good companions.
column4: A day like this is rare to see!

column2: Come, drink with this lonesome me. Will you?
So you are the rumour Royal Ordains. Turn around and leave.
We, the Red Leaf, are not so easy to defeat as the rabbits.
Nay, thee pitiful daws, our warriors shalt vanquish thee hither.
Yield and the King shall spare thy pitiful life f'r a chance to renew
Hmph, I do not think so! Catch me if you can.
Not bad for a bunch of upstarts.
But no further shall you inflict upon my mates!
To arms! The hunt shall now begin anew!
Hmm, what is that sound?
Oh. It appears you have really done it. Vengeance hath cometh.
We’re pleased to see you return once more, heroes of Royal Ordains.
And you bring with you the leader of the Red Leaf.
So bandit, to what end do you intend for your little campaign?
You must be the king who executed my foster father.
Then, know that my goal is to create a realm without suffering.
Your people in the north suffer greatly from famine and unjust taxation.
It is only right to steal back from robbers that exist above the law.
So, your intention did not align with that of your father.
Not in the least, a brute like him is best left in the grave.
So it is that you are not without the quality of a ruler.
We will now pronounce a decree for the Red Leaf bandits.
We sentence all members to the northern restoration for 6 winters.
You, Adaqua, will act as an arbitrator of labour administration.
With the commander's recommendation for adoption,
You will be part of the Akamanes as a lower noble of the fourth rank.
We also hereby grant you the title of Master of Hunt.
Your duty is to the venison accountment for both high and low society.
Make it so that your dream is fulfilled with your own hands.
What?! I... I accept your decree with all my heart.
I hereby swear my allegiance to you, my Lord, my King.
A great service you have provided to the northern people.
Justice has been delivered this day, and peace is ensured.
An example has been made that no outlaws shall prevail in our realm.
It is but a matter of time until the law of forest can be re-established.
The peasants and nobles alike will benefit from bountiful woodlands.
Those who disturb such balance will be punished with no exception.
Master of Hunt, the bandits did damage to the verts in Panac Forest.
You are given a task to ensure no more trespassing.
And ensure that the next game will be fulfilling for a three morns hunt.
As you command, Your Majesty.
The very next morn, I shall ride to the forest for overseer personally.
That is well. We wish you a complete success in this effort.
Thank you, Your Majesty. I will bring only good news back home.
Heroes, your rewards are sent to your storage as per usual.
I suggest you take appropriate respite before the next mission.
The Commander advised me the next task would be a perilous one.
Prepare for a long fight and come back victorious once more.
Another victorious day for you, Royal Ordains.
Again, I am most pleased with your accomplishments these days.
A small group they may be, but you surpass all their advantages.
I think you are more than ready for difficult tasks and foes ahead.
Speak with me once more when you are ready.
Have you rested enough to begin the next mission?
A notice was received that notified the strange wild's behaviour.
The inner woods now in turmoil with attacks from beasts of all manners.
We conjecture that someone is behind this incident.
Most likely a druid of baleful influence to command nature.
The beasts you will face are likely to be ferocious and fearless.
I implore you to be cautious in this endeavour for your success.
Like before, deal with the culpable druid as you see appropriate.
I look forward to hearing about your triumph.
May the One God watch over you in this journey.
Rest well. A hasty sally will only bring harm to the unprepared.
Hero, your success truly please me.
A mark of new growth I can see on you.
The rabbitmen did not cause you much trouble, did they?
You have proved well beyond any doubt of your potential.
With each victory, a full-fledged master of combat you will become.
Do reflect that the mettle of a hero is not only in personal strength.
Prepare well your equipment and bring suitable allies into battle.
Are you ready to start your next mission?
Very good. You will travel deeper into the Panac Forest.
Groups of bandits is using the forest as their base of operation.
The target of this mission is a group named Red Leaf.
The threat that needs to be dealt with this time is smaller in number.
But underestimate not, for they are much stronger individually.
Capture the leader, and the group will surely fall apart.
I leave it to your decision on how to deal with such a villain.
May the One God watch over you.
Take enough rest. The escorts will be prepared when you are ready.
Superb work, friend!
Thanks, friend! Let’s make a better one!
Ahh... It seems you did me a great disservice this day, maiden.
You may be pure of chastity, but your heart is not so.
It is best you leave me now, for I must deal with your accomplices.
Now tell me this intruder, are you after my horn or my life?
Hmm... it does matter none. Come to me horn at your own peril!
A byproduct of travelling in the wild.
It is not easy surviving out there with no civilisation to support you.
One more step toward the serenity of our land.
I will prepare a plan and legal document for the King to approve.
Did you notice that the city is made of no colour?
An army can not survive without food, you know?
Oh, my hand is killing me.
So I have been wondering for a while now.
Why does sitting and writing so tiring? Only two hands working
and the entire body is in place. It is no hard labour.
This parchment is really rough to the touch.
The book end here. Thanks the One God for this mercy.
Thanks the sun for going down so I may rest at last.
Brother, you think the scribe work is hard?
You should become illuminator instead.
My back ache and my eyes dim. I am visiting the tavern next.
Brother, you made a typo here.
The ink quality is abysmal. We should get a new supplier.
Sister, what with the colouring of this letter?
The colour composition make it really hard to discern.
Those who say writing is easy work never write for whole day.
Morning till night, morning till night. A scribe’s work never end.
I feel sorry for those who have to make a copy of this book.
Great mother mercy be my witness. I finish a page.
It is so cold today.
Well it is winter, you also complain about the heat in summer.
This page has way too many texts.
Why is this book so long.
Something is wrong with me today; I do not know of why.
I should do a sick leave later.
This is an outrage! A river stockfish for 5 coppers?
Must you be so hostile? We need to work together.
You have auburn of hair. A sign of magical attitude for us elf.
So, an elf servant among human nobles and auburn of hair.
As a fellow descendent of Lafarilna, you should not be here.
I will not divulge you in any inquiry regarding my origin, youngling.
Ha! the people indeed.
The one that thinks as what others want them to think.
While also want others to think like themselves.
Not even sheep are stupid enough to think themselves a wolf.
A drop of water in the wave of consciousness.
Believing themselves to be unique, special, and matter to the world.
I wonder what is wrong with this magic formula.
The pattern looks fine, and the incantation looks correct.
But the timing is severely less accurate than intended.
I assume it is not the vocal component that is off-note.
Of course not. I am no novice on this issue to make that blunder.
Hmm, let me see more closely.
I may be no mage, but my eyes can still see great details.
Here you are. Do be careful with it.
I shall. Well, well, I think I may know what caused the problem.
See this glyph here. It does not align properly with the one below.
Which one?
Do you have a ball game in your homeland?
We do, but not play with feet. A team game played with hands.
A match can last for a whole day, so we dedicate a festival to it.
Impressive, how do you play out?
Well, a festival match has two teams of 100 players and 10 balls.
